metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2911 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If the `recursive-clients` quota is reached on a BIND 9 resolver configured with both `stale-answer-enable yes;` and `stale-answer-client-timeout 0;`, a sequence of serve-stale-related lookups could cause `named` to loop and terminate unexpectedly due to a stack overflow. This issue affects BIND 9 versions 9.16.33 through 9.16.41, 9.18.7 through 9.18.15, 9.16.33-S1 through 9.16.41-S1, and 9.18.11-S1 through 9.18.15-S1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs mdeslaur> per upstream, affects 9.16.33 -> 9.16.41 and 9.18.7 -> 9.18.15

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.15').
